description: Children learn how to behave (socially and emotionally) by imitating the behavior of those closest to them.
title: Children learn how to behave (socially and emotionally) by imitating the behavior of those closest to them.
content:
The examples set by adults, older siblings and other children are the most powerful influences shaping a child’s behavior and personality. One way children learn is by copying what others do. If their parents treat each other with love and respect, this is what their children will learn and most likely ‘replay’ in their adult relationships.

If adults treat others with kindness, respect and patience, children will follow their example.
